channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box was discovered leaking and was placed in leaker bin to contain leakage. The outer box nor label had any Hazmat markings. The inner jug of Green Clean Liquid had 2 hazmat diamond labels. Both lids on the top of the jug were loose. Could not tell if it was also leaking from anywhere else.

item.title: Report E-2024110453
item.description:
Report E-2024110453

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 13, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured and released approximately four (4) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pail was collected in one (1) 30-gallon drum.

item.title: Report I-2024110061
item.description:
Report I-2024110061

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: Pottstown
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: RSI LEASING INC NS TBT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The fitting used to transfer the product is equipped with a valve and air fitting to allow the operator to blow the product line celar with compressed air. The fitting also has an in-line check valve to prevent product from being released into the air line. Unfortunately the check valve was removed by personnel due to difficulties in venting the transfer hose after it had been cleared. At the time of the incident, the oeprator left the air valve partially opened. That allowed product to flow out of the fitting when the main product valve was opened.
